se.miun.itm.input.util
Class ParamUtil

java.lang.Object
  se.miun.itm.input.util.ParamUtil

public class ParamUtil
extends java.lang.Object

A class upplying basic features to support the extraction of information from param elements or parsing and processing of id related services.

Author:
Felix Dobslaw

Constructor Summary

Method Summary
static java.lang.String deriveLocalId(java.lang.String id)
          retrieve the local id for a give parameter id.
static java.lang.String deriveLowestNonSharedId(java.lang.String dependantId, java.lang.String dependeeId)
          returns the smallest id start that both ids have in common, potentially "".
static java.lang.String deriveParamId(org.jdom2.Element param)
          retrieve the parameter id for a given InPUT parameter.
static java.lang.String deriveValueReferenceId(org.jdom2.Element original, Param param)
          for a given original xml element and an InPUT parameter element, retrieve the suitable id for the parameter depending on the value type (array, simple, collection).
static java.lang.String extractDescriptorId(java.io.InputStream codeMappingStream)
          extract the id for a given codemapping stream.

          extracts the descriptor id for a given descriptor file without using an xml parser.
static java.lang.String extractId(java.lang.String temp)
          a helper function that retrieves the value of the id field from a string.

          Retrieves the return type class for a given a method identifier and a param element.

          invokes the method with identifier identifier for parameter param, given the context that the cache provides.
static Param getParamForId(java.lang.String paramId, Param parentParam, ParamStore ps)
          returns the parameter from the parameter store, given its id.

          returns the local id of a parameter, given its global id.
static boolean hasGlobalParamSyntax(java.lang.String identifier)
          Is the parameter potentially a global parameter or an array object?
static boolean isMethodContext(java.lang.String identifier)
          Returns yes if the identifier of a constructor parameter, passed in the code mapping file, is of method type.
